docs.lead_paragraph: Twenty-two large banks in Europe may have accumulated credit losses of close to 400 billion euros for this year and next, according to officials who have seen a draft of conclusions of ''stress tests'' conducted by European regulators. At a meeting next Thursday and Friday in Sweden, European Union finance ministers are planning to publish a report on banking health based on the results of the tests, the officials, who were not authorized to speak publicly, said Friday. European finance ministers are also planning to initiate a stress test soon for European insurance companies, with the results to be assessed in the spring, the officials said.

headline.main: Stress Tests In Europe Show Risk Of Big Loss

docs.abstract: Officials who have seen draft of conclusions of stress tests conducted by European regulators say 22 large banks may have accumulated credit losses of close to 400 billion euros ($590 billion) for 2009 and 2010 (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: In talking about mandatory health insurance, President Obama has used the example of car insurance. Where I live, in Tennessee, it is required. For my age and driving experience, I pay $216 per month for insurance for my 2009 Prius. I am paying $457 per month for my health insurance. So yes, I support requiring everyone to have health insurance -- and having it cost less than half of what I am now paying. Sign me up! -- Linda A. Ramsbottom, 60, a construction contractor in Knoxville, Tenn., in a comment posted on the Prescriptions blog.
docs.abstract: Linda A Ramsbottom, construction contractor in Knoxville, Tenn, says that she supports Pres Obama's proposal requiring everyone to have health insurance (S)
